Where it all started. One of the founding fathers of modern gaming. It introduced being able to have a story in a first person shooter, Anybody that has played a game in the 90s has played it and a lot of people afterwards. An absolute classic. The gameplay is amazing with how interesting the combat can be and the story revolving around you which has been used in most single player valve games afterwards really makes you feel like Gordon Freeman. A normal guy at a lab where everything went wrong. You really feel like you're progressing to the surface throughout the game and even in the end which is pretty awful you just feel like you went from a man to a god. Of course this game is old and a little outdated. The puzzles can feel a bit tacky and weirdly put together but it's a very solid experience.
8/10

I've tried to play this. Honestly, I've tried. I just can't get into it. It's not my kind of game. If you enjoy it, all the power to you! I just find the game more frustrating than fun. Is it possible this is because the game released in 1998 and I am looking at it from a modern viewpoint? Possible. But I just have yet to have fun playing this game in my multiple attempts to enjoy it. I just don't see the hype. Maybe with another 3.5 hours I'll get into it.

its a fun action packed story rich and amazing game although its not just full of guns shooting monsters no there's actually a lot of puzzle solving and is very fun but not too difficult and the combat is fair although their are a few problems its an old game an old game with lots of bugs but the graphics are fine but if you want a better looking game black mesa is a game I recommend but buy and play this first and then black mesa to one really appreciate black mesa and half life and to support valve for a truly amazing game and a side note that there's if you have an 11-16 year old and think that this game is too violent there's and option to turn off blood and gruesome deaths (would not recommend in half life 2 episode 2) effectively turning it into a T game overall I recommend both this game and black mesa.

Very good game. the graphics are outdated sure but the graphics highlights the best of this games amazing quality. the horror aspect is there because you don't know when a pesky headcrab is going to jump at you and scare the living shit out of you because everything is lit up the game, doesn't reli on dark areas to try to scare you unlike most horror games, because everything is lit up you don't suspect anything until it happens. The story is really good, gameplay is absolutly amazing. Not alot of games these days create gameplay and story as or even close to as good as this.



20/10 would recommend.

This is an amazing classic but it is so incredibly old that you would have a lot more fun playing the fan remake "Black Mesa". It has the same lore but upgrades the graphics and physics engine. (From goldsource to source). You can still play this for the nostalgia though! Half-Life 2 has had a much longer life probably because it's engine was so advanced for it's time it still holds up to this day.
